Waiting List Restrictions:Passengers with waiting list tickets are no longer allowed to travel in Sleeper or AC coaches. These tickets are now only valid for travel in general (unreserved) coaches.

Fines for Violations:Passengers found travelling in reserved coaches with a waiting list ticket will face fines of ₹250 for Sleeper class and ₹440 for AC class. Additionally, they may be charged the fare from the train's starting point to where they were caught.

Reduced Advance Reservation Period (ARP):The period for booking tickets in advance has been reduced from 120 days to 60 days.

Mandatory OTP Verification for Online Bookings:One-Time Password (OTP) verification via mobile number is now compulsory for all online ticket bookings made through the IRCTC website or app.

Increased Smoking Fine:The fine for smoking on trains has increased from ₹200 to ₹500.

Stricter Luggage Rules:Carrying luggage exceeding the allowed limits without booking it will incur a penalty of six times the regular fee for the excess weight.

Late Cancellation Charges:Canceling a ticket less than 4 hours before departure will now result in a forfeiture of 25% of the ticket fare.

Limited Tatkal Ticket Refunds:No refund will be given on confirmed Tatkal tickets unless the train is canceled or delayed by more than 3 hours.

AI-Based Seat Allocation:Indian Railways is now using Artificial Intelligence to assign seats more efficiently, aiming to reduce waiting list numbers and improve the booking experience.

Revenue:The company reported a consolidated revenue of ₹1220.87 crore, showing a 2.8% increase quarter-on-quarter (QoQ) and a 4.2% year-over-year (YoY) increase.

Profit After Tax:Profit after tax stood at ₹330.70 crore, a 16.4% QoQ rise and a 7.5% YoY rise.

Earnings Per Share (EPS):The EPS for Q1FY26 was ₹4.10, representing a 17.1% increase from the previous quarter and a 5.1% increase from the same period last year.
